title: Lowest Energy Depletion Impact
description: In 2021, Armenia had an exceptionally low energy depletion cost of $1.11, representing a negligible 0.0000000082% of its GNI, showcasing efficient energy use.

title: Minimal Coal Dependency
description: Armenia's coal rents were virtually non-existent in 2021, accounting for only 0.00000028% of its GDP, highlighting minimal reliance on coal.

title: High Social Insurance Coverage
description: In 2022, 60.23% of Armenia's population was covered by social insurance programs, with the poorest quintile having a slightly higher coverage of 61.64%.

title: Predominantly Female Secondary Education Workforce
description: As of 2023, 88.38% of secondary education teachers in Armenia were female, indicating a strong female presence in the education sector.

title: Low Incidence of Gender-Based Violence Beliefs
description: In 2016, only 0.4% of Armenian women believed a husband was justified in beating his wife for burning food, and 0.8% for refusing sex, reflecting progressive attitudes.

title: Minimal Bribery in Tax Meetings
description: In 2020, only 0.1% of firms in Armenia expected to give gifts during meetings with tax officials, indicating low corruption levels.

title: Low Urban Sanitation Services Usage
description: In 2018, only 6% of Armenia's urban population used safely managed sanitation services, highlighting a significant area for improvement.

title: Minimal Government Education Spending
description: In 2023, Armenia's government expenditure on education was only 0.24% of its GDP, suggesting limited investment in education.
